column1: short outside off, he gives room and cuts to cover
arm ball sliding on, he's back and mistiming to mid off
Bowled him! Fired quicker on middle, it shoots low and skids on, he plays all over it and it crashes into off! What a start for the Stars
tossed up on leg, he works this with the little bit of turn to midwicket
shorter length outside off, he's back and punching to long off
96kph, fired down leg, it comes off his pad and rolls fine for a leg bye
136kph, good length, fourth stump, he's back and forcing this to midwicket
edged and fine of third man! It might have been wide of the slip. It was a length ball wide, he slashed and got a thick edge that flies fine
lovely cut past backward point! A hint of width and he caressed it past point with supreme timing
back of a length, 122kph, slower ball, wide of off, he mistimes a back foot drive
135kph, back of a length, on off, he stands up and punches to mid off
116kph, slower ball, outside off, he waits and drives straight to cover
Bowled him! Khawaja trying to pull a fuller length that skidded on! This was fired through again, it wasn't a length to pull, he played all over it as it slid on and crashed into off.
94kph, darted into middle, he's back and tucking this to midwicket
fuller on middle, he works this with the limited turn to midwicket
drifting into leg, he works this to midwicket
arm ball, 101kph, he's back and forcing this to cover
angled into leg, he's back and clipping this off the pads to deep midwicket
134kph, angled into off, he drives forcefully to mid on
beaten sparing with no feet at a good length that just shaped away wide of off
136kph, back of a length, shaping away, he guides this to third man
play and miss trying to cut a 135kph, ball angled across. It was close to him
134kph, good length, top of off, he mistimes trying to punch through the off side, chops it off the bottom edge
137kph, short and wide and he laces this behind point! Just too much width this time.
97kph, tossed up on off, he clips this through midwicket to the sweeper
punched superbly though cover off the back foot! Length ball fired at off, he's back and punching this with a vertical bat. Great shot
A scoop fine! It was fired fuller and quicker, he predicted it and scoop ramped it fine over the keeper.
drifting into middle, he clips this to midwicket
full outside off, he drives to mid off
full into leg stump, 99kph, he tucks this to square leg
leg break on leg, he clips this through midwicket
wrong un wide of off, he's back and missing a cut
tossed up on middle, he drives back to the bowler
quicker ball, on middle, he pushes to Maxwell on the circle at mid on and they take a sharp one
drifting into middle, he work this with the drift wide of mid on for two
looped up on off, he clips it to mid on
angled down leg, he's back and working this to fine leg
fuller on off, he drives to mid off
144kph, shorter length, it skids on, gets an inside edge onto body trying to pull and it rolls away
back of a length angled down leg and called wide
ramped straight to third man! Short ball outside off, the pace surprised him, he opened the face to run it to third man and ramped it with the pace and it carried all the way to Zampa on the rope!
143kph, full speared into middle, he drives off the toe of the bat to mid on
139kph, full and tailing into leg, he clips this wide of mid on for a couple
136kph, fuller angled wide and he swings and misses
137kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot through point
dropped by Handscomb! Good length, 140kph, just shaped late, caught the edge, Handscomb is close, got two hands moving to his right and grassed it
an lbw appeal but maybe pitching outside leg! Gee that was close. Maybe he hit it. It was pitching in line and probably hitting
lofted over mid off! Didn't nail it but got enough to lift the drive up and over!
another lbw appeal! Again not out! Steyn can't believe it. He was pulling a length ball that skidded on. Did it pitch outside leg? Yes, just. By millimetres. It was crashing into middle
fuller and wider of off, he swings and misses
short ball outside off, he pulls to mid on
angled down leg, way wide down leg
146kph, angled into the pads, it rolls away fine, they pinch two leg byes to fine leg. Good running. That was close to leg stump as well. The lbw was turned down
bouncer, over leg, he ducks under it
143kph, angled down leg, it comes off pad and runs for four leg byes!
play and miss trying to square drive a 144kph, ball wide of off
wrong un outside leg, he defends on the front foot
leg break outside off, he sweeps behind square to the man in the deep
wrong un, he tries to sweep and misses. It just missed off. Handscomb appeal for a stumping. They check upstairs. His toe was down. Not out
drifting into middle, 91kph, he defends from the crease
a clever reverse sweep! He swapped his hands and slapped it behind point, picking the gap
tossed up, on off, he drives to deep cover point
133kph, good length tailing in, he defends from the crease
138kph, short ball, he pulls miscuing it behind square and it falls safe into the gap
133kph, good length outside off, he leans into a square drive through point
short and wide, he's back and cutting, backward point misfields, it's wide of third man and they get two
135kph, angled down leg, it's called wide
good length, fifth stump line, he's back and guiding to third man
length ball, 133kph, on leg, he flicks this in the air behind square but well short of the man in the deep
looped up on middle, he shuffles down and clips this to the circle at midwicket, they take on the man running in with a second and beat him
pushed through outside off, he's back and chopping a bottom edge trying to cut
caught at long on! Tossed up on middle, he skips out to launch down the ground, gets it off the toe and miscues completely, hitting straight to Steyn who is 20m off the rope. Easy catch
waist high full and reverse sweeps! He hammers this past point! He could hit that anywhere but he reverse pulled it past point
tossed up on off, he drives to long off
tossed up on middle, he sweeps from middle behind square
tossed up on off, he pushes this through cover-point
launched over the sightscreen! What a strike! Tossed up in the arc wide of off and he freed the arms and dragged it straight! It was a sweet strike
drifting into leg, he pushes this on the front foot to long on
shorter length, he's giving room to crack to cover
lofted flat and straight of long off! It was tossed up and he sliced it inside out but straight of long on

caught and bowled! A full toss and he slapped it straight back to Zampa! Good catch. It was a knee high full toss and he completely miscued it straight back to the bowler who took a good catch infront of his eyes
141kph, angled into leg, he clips this fine to the man in the deep
141kph, good length, wide of off, he defends with an open bat face to backward point
beaten, 139kph, good length wide of off, it shot low, he missed
he steps across outside off, he tries to whip across the line, hit on the pad, an lbw appeal but it's outside the line
nearly a run out! Good length on middle, he's back and turning this to midwicket, they take on Maxwell and Sams would have been out if he hit!
beaten trying to run a length ball to third man
135kph, back of a length, wide, he's back and cutting behind point, they run well to get two
136kph, he drives and gets a thick inside edge past leg to fine leg
135kph, good length, outside off, he defends off the open face to backward point
full outside off, he mows across the line, dragging it to deep midwicket and he gets off the mark!
chest high short ball, he pulls this through square leg to the man in the deep
137kph, angled in, swings hard and misses and it just misses leg!
tossed outside off, he whips across the line to deep midwicket
dropped at long on by Maxwell! He was diving forward at one that was hammered flat. Tough chance but he would hold those more often that not
back of a length, worked through midwicket
tossed up, he slog sweeps but miscues to long on
tossed up outside off, he drives to cover
tossed up, and a step hit over the sightscreen! It was right in the slot, he gave room and swung straight through the line launching it straight
137kph, back of a length, he swipes a pull across the line wide of mid on for a couple
137kph, length ball, he sets himself, miscues in the air but it drops just short of Dunk on the circle at mid on
135kph, full on middle, he checks a drive straight of mid on for a single
135kph, low full toss, tailing in, he whips this behind square to the sweeper
length ball, comes off thigh guard and Handscomb dropped it down leg. They pinch a leg bye. He might have got an inside edge as well but he dropped it anyway
short ball, he hammers a pull forward of square and the man in the deep has to make a diving save
this is angled down leg, it comes off the pad and is called wide! That clearly touched the pad
139kph low full toss on middle, he drives to long on
shovelled through midwicket with the bottom hand! Powerful shot. It was full into leg stump and he smashed it along the ground to the midwicket rope
beaten flashing at a cut outside off
Bowled him! Middle stump is flattened! 143kph, fired into middle, he tried to swing this over midwicket and was beaten by raw pace!
147kph angled into middle, he defends this to midwicket and pinches a single
Bowled him! 147kph top of off! Way too quick. Back of a length off, he's caught on the crease, plays all around it. Ross was blown away by how quick that was.
143kph, back of a length, he late cuts wide of third man and Rauf does a great job to keep it to one
141kph, good length on off, he shuffles down and defends
edged to fine third man! Too quick. It was a length ball, shaping away, he nudges at it and gets a thick edge that races to the rope
142kph, shorter length wide of off, he tries to late but but misses
141kph, chest high short ball, he controls a pull wide of fine leg to the gap for two
141kph, fuller on off, he pushes at it, chipping it towards mid on for a single
146kph, speared into leg a huge appeal for lbw not out is the call, umpire says he got an inside edge, it runs to fine third man
140kph, angled down leg, he swings at it and misses. They appeal but it's not out but not called a wide. Not sure what it hit
flicked wide of fine leg! This was angled into leg at 145kph, he set himself and flicked it with the angled to the rope
swings and misses and it just whizzed past off stump
missed run out! That was a length ball, 147kph, he tries to pull, it comes off off the thigh guard, Hinchliffe runs in, gathers and throws but the throw was really poor and wide of the stump
paddled to fine leg! Skilful shot. Angled down leg, he stepped inside the line to paddle ramp it and he beat fine leg!
full and angled in towards middle, nicely behind that and pushes it back to the bowler
length outside off, doesn't quite come on, Maddinson is a little bit on the walk, searching for the ball, pushes it into the off side
full and angled in, clipped nicely but straight to short midwicket, who could well be a catching option here
length outside off, too close for the cut, Maddinson slashes and misses
slower one outside off, waits for it, opens the face and runs it towards short third

knocks him over and a wicket maiden to kickstart their defence! It was a length ball that kept a tad low and didn't quite come on, not the kind of pitch where crosses batted shots are likely to come off, he was through the pull too early and the ball slipped under his bat to hit off stump. Poor shot from Maddinson, disaster for Stars
length outside off, defended towards cover
length on the stumps, patted to midwicket
that was coming, given the build up of dot balls. Fuller outside off and he goes through with the on-drive, feet still but still well balanced and smashes it past mid-off to the boundary
length on the stumps, pushed gently towards mid-off. No single there
clubbed through extra cover, but Hales is running after it from mid-off and manages to slide and save it just before the boundary
fired in quicker on the stumps, nudged through midwicket
good length on off stump, pushed to cover
width offered and slashed through cover but there is protection in the deep via a sweeper, so only a single
too straight, and he shuffles across to tuck it to fine leg
digs it in short, but it's on leg stump, Larkin gets inside the line and pulls to fine leg
good length on off, steered to point on the front foot
slower ball, full toss on off stump, read it late and had to just defend it
length on the stumps, punched back past the bowler, mid-on fields
length ball angling into him, pushes to mid-on, but with softer hands, so they get a single
back of a length outside off, steered to backward point. that was quick, 143.7  kph
length ball, keeping it on a tight line outside off and all the batsman can do is pat it into the offside
the batsman adjusts this time, by shuffling across and the bowler has shortened his length marginally, which allows him to unleash a short-arm pull to the square leg boundary
nips back in off the seam and hits him on the pad, loud shout for lbw turned down. He might have got a tickle on it, but it might have gone down leg too
just short of midwicket. Too early into the flick, and it pops up in the air off the inside half of the bat
whew, that's some wrist power. Too full, and he just whips it off his pads to the square leg boundary. One bounce into the fence
better length that time, not full and not short, he pushes it gently towards point to take a quick single
too full again, he misses on the flick, but it strikes pad and goes past the keeper. Very fine and there's no cutting that off
yorker, tailing in late, on the stumps, inside edged onto pad and it rolls back towards the bowler
length ball nipping in, he doesn't connect again, but it rolls towards short leg off the thigh pad and they get another leg bye
super shot Full ball, almost yorker length on the stumps, but he gave himself some room and drove it straight back past the bowler, showing the full face of the bat
nicely timed cut, gets low and cuts it from the stumps, but stopped by Khawaja at point. He can't stop it cleanly, the balls' travelling fast, so they get a single
length ball on the stumps, steered towards point
whack. Too short, he spots it and gets into position early, goes on the back foot to pull this powerfully to the midwicket boundary
slower ball, he's not read it, wanted to push it towards cover but gets an inside edge towards short fine leg
angled into him, defended solidly towards mid-off
too full and on the pads, flicked to deep square leg
length ball on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
back of a length on off, not short enough to execute a perfect pull, and this is not perfectly done. Gets it off the bottom half of the bat to square leg
fuller outside off, driven to mid-off's left. They take a single
boom. Stoinis has been feeling the pressure of dot balls you'd think, and he unleashes a powerful on-drive. Full ball in the slot, takes a half-step forward and sends it way over long-on
moves across to tuck it to midwicket
too full, straying on the pads, and whipped to deep midwicket. Strong wrist-work
jabbed to mid-on
length ball angling into him, keeps a tad low, he jams it to midwicket, bringing bat down late
length outside off, he stays back and slaps it to extra cover. Hits hard, but timing's a bit awry and the placement is off, straight to the fielder
full toss on the pads, turned to deep square leg
full ball tailing into him, tries to flick it, but can't time it well. goes to square leg
back of a length on the fourth stump, he stays beside it and cuts it through backward point
beaten. Length outside off, nips in slightly and goes past the outside edge while he's trying to push it into the offside
slower ball, on a length outside off, punched without timing to cover
length ball, slower one again, no pace for Stoinis to work with. He can only nudge it to mid-on
normal pace, low full toss on the stumps. He was giving himself room, and drove it to extra cover, but can't beat Ferguson
length ball on the stumps, patted to long-on
giving himself room, slaps this leg stump yorker to long-on
giving himself room, but the bowler follows. Ends up with a length ball coming into him, and he can't get it away
fuller on the stumps, driven to mid-off while on the move
width outside off and slashed, but there is a deep point
giving himself room again, the bowler keeps it on middle stump. He cuts it again, but the fielder at deep point cleans up
yorker, tailing in on leg stump, flicked to long-on
makes as if to give himself room but stays in his crease. The bowler's not taking the bait, keeps it back of a length on the stumps, punched to point
short ball on off stump, times it well with a nice crack on the pull shot, but there is a fielder in the deep so they get only one
slower ball, tried to paddle it, was too early into the shot, spoons up off the pad, but falls short of short fine leg.
gave himself room to have a thrash at it, but absolutely not timing on that flat-batted slap from down on one knee. Only trickles to mid-off

nails the placement this time, though a valiant effort from Green at the midwicket boundary. Short ball and he rocks back to pull fiercely. Green knows he can't catch it, but tries to dive to his right to at least parry it away from the boundary. Gets a hand on it, but can't stop it from trickling over
keeps this fuller and wider of off, mis-timed drive to extra cover
tossed up on a length outside off, he takes a stride out and flick-drives it to deep midwicket
tossed up on leg stump, Stoinis gives himself room and drives it straight. The bowler can't field cleanly so they get a single
fuller on the stumps, worked to deep midwicket on the front foot
drags it down short and the batsman has an almighty swing at it. Doesn't connect as cleanly as he wanted, and it goes to midwicket off the bottom half of the bat
goes deep in his crease and uses his wrists to turn this between long-on and deep midwicket

bang. The big shot was always around the corner. This one was floated up on a fuller length outside off and Stoinis opts to go down on one knee and flat bat it powerful and straight. Goes all the way, over the boundary
length ball jagging in, but the radar's off, pitches on leg and goes further down. He'll need to rebowl that
slower ball, on a length outside off, and he's way too early into the cut. Doesn't connect. Kept a bit low too
jagging in from outside off again, he was trying to tuck it through midwicket, but gets an inside edge onto pad that rolls to short third man
smoked. That is a super shot. Casually steps away to give himself room and slams this full ball it past the bowler, into the straight boundary
stepping away again but this time the bowler follows, and Stoinis can only tap it to midwicket
too full again and smashed again. Clears his front leg and powerfully drives it straight. Another boundary
length on the stumps, he moves across and tucks it fine
nicely executed reverse sweep, but he's timed it too well and it races to the short third man fielder. they take the single anyway and make it in time
fired in quick on leg stump, jabbed back to the bowler
tossed up, ends up as a full toss. He wants to whack this into oblivion, but gets it on the top half of the bat and it goes straighter than intended. Doesn't carry to long-on
nailed it. Floated up on the stumps, he clears his front leg, goes down and slog-sweeps with a nice, free swing of the bat. Connects very cleanly and sends it over deep midwicket
shuffles across and nudges this through midwicket. The fielder has gone right back because of that last-ball six, which means they can run two.
superb maiden BBL fifty for Larkin and he's got there with another good shot. Fetched the sweep from outside off, connected sweetly and threaded the gap to beat deep midwicket and square leg
length ball on off, punched to cover
length on middle stump, goes across and flicks it off his pads to deep square leg
back of a length on the stumps, swivels to pull this to deep square leg. Didn't try to go too hard, kept it along the ground
upper cut for four. Short ball on off stump, he watched it closely and just ramped it over the keeper. Cheeky shot, perfectly executed
length outside off, cuts it to cover
length outside off, pushed to cover
fuller on the stumps, uses his wrists to whip through midwicket
floated up, gets some drift into the right-hander, Stoinis goes inside out, chips it over extra cover
floated up outside off, and he brings out the sweep again. He's played that shot well all innings long
flatter and fuller on the stumps, driven powerfully to long-on to raise fifty.
tossed up well outside of, he wanted to smoke that through cover, but gets a thick edge to send it to backward point
down the track, almost gets into a tangle with the bowler firing it into him, but chips it over mid-on to keep strike
full ball homing in on middle stump, but Larkin nonchalantly swats it inside out, over extra cover. Didn't time it perfectly but got it over the in-field and into the boundary
picks out fine leg. Short ball, on target, he goes for the pull, but gets it high on the bat. It gets more loop than distance and is gobbled up by the fielder. End of a fine innings
oooh that's just dismissed nonchalantly. Short ball and he almost seems to put in no effort in pulling this. Just swivels and elegantly hits it, races to the square leg boundary
fuller, and flicked to deep midwicket
short ball outside off, he fetches the pull from there and connects, but a dive to his right by mid-off ensures there's no boundary

Stoinis has shovelled this down long-on's throat. I'ts more of a deep mid-on almost. Full ball on the stumps, he went deep and used his powerful wrists to hit it sweetly - but straight to the man. is there a twist in the tale?
whoa, what a shot! He was shaping to pull this, but changed his mind at the last moment because it was a slower bouncer. Ends up hanging his bat and it takes the outside edge to fly past the keeper

run out chance missed at the non-striker's end. Pressure, pressure! There was no run there with the ball tapped down the wicket, but they went for the run anyway. Handscombe was miles out as Sams sprinted down the track, gathered the ball and had a shy, but missed the stumps.

caught behind! What is happening to the Stars. Three wickets in the last nine balls when they were cruising. This was a full ball outside off, and Maxwell tried to steer it fine, but only snicked it through to the keeper.

bowled him! What a ball, what a time to strike, and what a nail-biter this is turning into suddenly. Pitched on a length and jagged back into the left-hander sharply, past the bat and cannons into the stumps.
full ball outside off, steered to backward point. No hat-trick, but it's a dot ball
bouncer on leg stump, he ducks under it. and it's been given a wide. the bowler can't believe it.
and Coulter-Nile has just anti-climaxed a thrilling finish. Full ball on the stumps, driven crisply down the ground, very straight, to find the boundary.
run out chance missed - second one in two overs. Fuller on the stumps, just tapped it towards mid-on and ran. Bit of scrambled thinking there. Mid-on ran in and had a shy, but missed the stumps.
well bowled, yorker on middle and off, but well negotiated, getting bat down in time and angling it to steer the ball towards point
yorker length outside off, driven off the front foot by opening the bat face, but can't beat cover
misses the yorker, ends up as a full toss outside off, flicked to deep square leg. Could have had a boundary, but a single will also do for Stars
nails the yorker on middle stump, the batsman digs it back out to the bowler's right. A very straight and short mid-on fields
full ball tailing in, inside edges the flick onto pad. No run.
yorker on the fifth stump, he shuffles across and taps it towards square leg. They sneak a quick single

caught at mid-on. Ho ho ho, this match is not over yet folks. Full and straight delivery, NCN, moved across and flicked it off his toes, timed it well actually. but there is a wide mid-on in place - in addition to the shorter, straighter mid-on, and he picks him out perfectly.

trapped him lbw Oh my word, this is a thriller like no other. Length ball, jagged in and hit him on the knee roll of the back leg. Terrible choice of shot, trying to swipe across the line. The umpire takes an age to raise his finger, but he does it eventually. Stars fleetingly would have thought they won it by running a leg-bye. Not quite yet.
Zampa's done it for Stars. Finally. Full ball tailing into him, he nudges it past square leg and they scamper the winning run comfortably.
